abstract: Republican Senators block the passage of a narrowed version of the jobs bill championed by Pres Obama; the Senate vote split 50 to 50 and Democrats needed 60 votes to overcome a Republican filibuster.
snippet: For the second time in 10 days, the Senate on Thursday rejected Democratic efforts to take up a jobs bill championed by President Obama.
lead_paragraph: For the second time in 10 days, the Senate on Thursday rejected Democratic efforts to take up a jobs bill championed by President Obama.

headline.main: Obama’s Jobs Plan Is Blocked Again by Senate Republicans
headline.print_headline: Obama’s Jobs Plan, Now Piecemeal, Is Blocked Again by Senate Republicans
headline.seo: New Senate Battle Over Obama’s Jobs Bill, Now Piecemeal
